column4: _On-street parking occurs in public space, which means that an on-street parking spot cannot belong to a specific individual, and people park in different places at different times._ What do you consider the threshold which is reasonable to expect to park in a neighborhood, most of the time?
1. within 100 feet, or about a 30-second walk
2. on the precise block, about a one-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
2. on the precise block, about a one-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
3. within one block in any direction, about a two- to four-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
4. within two-to-three blocks, about a five- to seven-minute walk
5. within the general neighborhood, about a ten-minute walk
